intro: Oenanthe sophiae, commonly known as the Caucasian water-dropwort, is a herbaceous plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as stream banks and forest edges. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, often fern-like appearance. The small white flowers are clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family.
